page.title: 01Location
page.content: The area lies part in Cranfield parish and mainly in Marston Moretaine parish.To the west the area rises from 100 feet to part of the ridge of boulder clay which overlooks the area to the east - the Marson Vale.This vale of Oxford clay runs south-west to north-east through the area.A wide, flat bottomed valley between the ridge of boulder clay and the Greensand ridge to the south.The clay has been extracted by the Fletton Brick Industry and large pits remain such as the Brogborough 2 pit in the south of the area, dug to serve the Ridgmont brickworks.The A 421, a major route from the M1 to Bedford and the east coast crosses the area and passes through Marston Moretaine, the major centre of population,for which a By -Pass is proposed.
